Description: Round-topped limestone stela of prince and count Puheri, probably executed in the Napatan period although in an archaic style reflecting the art of the 13th Dynasty: hieroglyphs with winged solar disc; relief representation of the Nile-god, Hapy, making offerings before a serekh containing the Horus-name, Sekhemkara Sankhtawi, most probably a Kushite monarch or perhaps utilising the name of Amememhet V; the lower section contains a dedicatory inscription on behalf of the owner.
Curator's comments: Published: PM IV, p.65 HTBM 4: Plate 22 J Baines, Fecundity Figures (Warminster, 1985), 291.
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
